Annotation.String: The reset action resets the manager settings to factory defaults as specified by NVIDIA.
This action shall reset the manager settings to factory defaults as specified by NVIDIA. This action will delete all log entries and diagnostic data.
This action is used to invoke a synchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This action shall invoke a synchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
The type of the target.
This parameter shall contain the type of the target.
The instance ID of the target.
This parameter shall contain the instance ID of the target.
Opcode defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Opcode defined in SMBPBI specification.
Arg1 defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Arg1 defined in SMBPBI specification.
Arg2 defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Arg2 defined in SMBPBI specification.
Data-In defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Data-In defined in SMBPBI specification.
Extended Data arguments defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Extended Data arguments defined in SMBPBI specification.
This action is used to invoke an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This action shall invoke an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
The type of the target.
This parameter shall contain the type of the target.
The instance ID of the target.
This parameter shall contain the instance ID of the target.
Arg1 of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the Arg1 of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
The input data of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the input data of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
The requested bytes of output data for an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This parameter shall contain the requested bytes of output data for an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This action is used to invoke a raw command defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This action shall invoke a raw command defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
The device identification ID defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Type 0 Specification.
This parameter shall contain the device identification ID defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Type 0 Specification.
The instance ID of the device defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Type 0 Specification.
This parameter shall contain the instance ID of the device defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Type 0 Specification.
Indicates whether the operation for the command is completed asynchronously.
This parameter shall indicate whether the operation for the command is completed asynchronously.
NVIDIA Message Type defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This parameter shall contain the NVIDIA Message Type defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
Command code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This parameter shall contain the command code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
Data size of the request payload in bytes defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This parameter shall contain the data size of the request payload in bytes defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
Data field of the request payload defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This parameter shall contain the data field of the request payload defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base Specification.
This action is used to perform software error injections on a debug firmware image.
This action shall perform software error injections on a debug firmware image, without hardware interactions.
The type of the requested operations.
This parameter shall contain the type of the requested operations. The entire flow includes `Setup`, `Injection` and `Cleanup` operations.
Indicates whether the values of the Health properties should be set to `OK` prior to performing the error injections.

This parameter shall indicate whether the values of the Health properties should be set to `OK` prior to performing the error injections. This parameter is allowed for the `Setup` or `Injection` operation. If this parameter is not provided by the client, the default is `false`.
Indicates whether the existing log entries should be preserved prior to performing the error injections.

This parameter shall indicate whether the existing log entries should be preserved prior to performing the error injections. This parameter is allowed for the `Injection` operation. If this parameter is not provided by the client, the default is `false`.
The Error ID.
This parameter shall contain the Error ID, as specified in the NVIDIA Server RAS Catalog. This parameter is allowed for the `Injection` operation.
The index of the devices.

This parameter shall contain the index of the devices, as specified in the NVIDIA Server RAS Catalog. This parameter is allowed for the `Injection` operation. If this parameter is not provided by the client, the default is `0`.
Indicates whether recovery process should be performed after the error injections.

This parameter shall indicate whether recovery process should be performed after the error injections. A successful recovery shall expect the Resolved values updated to `true` in the log entries. This parameter is allowed for the `Injection` operation. If this parameter is not provided by the client, the default is `false`.
Indicates whether the entire flow from `Setup`, `Injection` to `Cleanup` operations should be performed.

This parameter shall indicate whether the entire flow from `Setup`, `Injection` to `Cleanup` operations should be performed. This parameter is allowed for the `Injection` operation. If this parameter is not provided by the client, the default is `false`.
The build type of the firmware associated with the manager.
This property shall indicate the build type of the firmware associated with the manager.
An indication of whether OTP of the manager has been provisioned.
This property shall indicate whether OTP of the manager has been provisioned.
The SMBPBI fencing privilege.
This property shall contain the SMBPBI fencing privilege.
An indication of whether authentication and TLS are required for the service provided by this manager.

The value of this property shall indicate whether authentication and TLS are required for the service provided by this manager, where a value `false` shall indicate that the service does not require authentication and TLS for all resources. The default value is `false`. Once it is set to `true`, the service shall not allow this value to be overwritten.
The settings of resources that allow client to use a redundancy channel to communicate.
This property shall contain the settings of resources that allow client to use a redundancy channel to communicate.
Indicates whether the UpdateService resource is configured to use a redundancy channel.
This property shall indicate whether the UpdateService resource is configured to use a redundancy channel. The default shall be false.
Indicates whether the ComponentIntegrity resource is configured to use a redundancy channel.
This property shall indicate whether the ComponentIntegrity resource is configured to use a redundancy channel. The default shall be false.
The response from a synchronous raw command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This object shall contain the response from a synchronous raw command defined in SMBPBI specification.
Status Register defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the Status Register defined in SMBPBI specification.
Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
Extended Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the Extended Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
The response from an asynchronous raw command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This object shall contain the response from an asynchronous raw command defined in SMBPBI specification.
Status Register defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the Status Register defined in SMBPBI specification.
Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the Data-Out defined in SMBPBI specification.
The output data of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
This property shall contain the output data of an asynchronous command defined in SMBPBI specification.
The firmware includes software to provision the debug OTP keys and is signed with debug keys.
The firmware includes software to provision the production OTP keys and is signed with production keys.
The firmware doesn't include OTP provisioning software and is signed with debug keys.
The firmware doesn't include OTP provisioning software and is signed with production keys.
The firmware includes software to provision the debug OTP keys and is signed with debug keys. The firmware also enables debug tools for the development.
The firmware doesn't include OTP provisioning software and is signed with debug keys. The firmware also enables debug tools for the development.
HMC has SMBPBI privilege.
Host BMC has SMBPBI privilege.
No host has SMBPBI privilege.
The target is GPU.
The target is NVSwitch.
The target is Baseboard.
This version was created to add `ProvisioningDevelopment` and `PlatformDevelopment` to FirmwareBuildType.
The settings of persistent storage attached to this manager.
The property shall contain the settings of persistent storage attached to this manager.
An indication of whether the persistent storage is enabled.
This property shall indicate whether the persistent storage is enabled. The default value is `false`. Once it is set to `true`, the service shall not allow this value to be overwritten.
The response from a raw command defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
This object shall contain the response from a raw command defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
NVIDIA Message Type defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
This property shall contain the NVIDIA Message Type defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
Command code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
This property shall contain the command code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
Completion code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
This property shall contain the completion code defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
Data field of the response payload defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
This property shall contain the data field of the response payload defined in the NVIDIA System Management (NSM) API Base specification.
The settings of OpenOCD service attached to this manager.
The property shall contain the settings of OpenOCD service attached to this manager.
The wall-clock time this process has been running in seconds.
This property shall contain the wall-clock time this process has been running in seconds.
An indication of whether OpenOCD service is enabled.
This property shall indicate whether OpenOCD service is enabled. The default value is `false`.
Fabric Manager state.
This property shall contain the Fabric Manager state.
The report status.
This property shall contain the status for a report received from the Fabric Manager.
The time passed since last restart, in seconds.
This property shall contain the time passed since last restart, in seconds.
Fabric Manager is at init stage, before the Fabric Manager can start sending telemetry.
Fabric Manager init is done, waiting for Subnet Manager to finish init.
Fabric Manager and Subnet Manager init in done.
Error occurs in Fabric Manager or Subnet Manager.
An unknown state.
Report didn't received yet.
Report received.
Report timeout.
An unknown state.
Set up environment for performing software error injections.
Clean up environment for performing software error injections.
Perform software error injections.
